events.name: GCTC Virtual Kick off and Bluemix and Internet of Things Webinar
events.description: The Global City Teams Challenge (GCTC) is an initiative designed to advance the deployment of Internet of Things (IoT) technologies within a smart city / smart community environment. We would like to invite you to a Virtual Kick-off session for GCTC. It is hosted by the GCTC and IBM. This event will include an introduction by National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Program Director and a demonstration of the IoT tools and platform that IBM is making available to GCTC participants. Do join us to find out more of this exciting challenge and also pass this information on to all developers out there.  Date: Thursday, January 22, 2016Time: 10:00am (Singapore Time)Duration: 1 hour 30 minutesRegistration Link: http://ibm.biz/gctcwebkickoff2 <Topic - Speaker>Information about the GCTC - Dr. Sokwoo Rhee (NIST Program DirectorIntroduction to Bluemix and IoT Foundation - Oliver Rodriguez (IBM Technical Evangelist) See you virtually!

events.name: Friday Hacks #105 - That Roomba Raspberry Pi Kinect Hack
events.description:
Welcome back to a brand new semester! We're kicking off Friday Hacks with a talk by a SoC student about his interesting side project with a Roomba. 

Date/Time: Friday, Jan 22 at 6:30pm 
Free pizza is served before the talks. 

# That Roomba Raspberry Pi Kinect Hack

While procrastinating one day, Fazli thought it was a good idea to duct-tape a Kinect, a Raspberry Pi, a Roomba and an empty biscuit tin together. So, he went and duct-taped a Kinect, a Raspberry Pi, a Roomba and an empty biscuit tin together. It wasn’t such a great idea.

Come to the talk anyway to see Fazli describe what he learnt during his miserable experience in agonizing detail. Also, witness live demos of his robot attempting Simultaneous Localisation and Mapping (SLAM) of a totally untested environment. What could possibly go wrong?

# Speaker profile

Fazli Sapuan is a Year 4 CS student who likes to procrastinate and do stupid random stuff like duct-taping a Kinect, a Raspberry Pi, a Roomba and an empty biscuit tin together. His hobbies include: hacking stuff together, fountain pen collecting and not getting fined by the school for misconduct.
events.location: Video Conference Room (COM1-02-13), School of Computing, National University of Singapore

events.name: TGIFHacks #43
events.description:
Welcome back everyone!

This week, at TGIFHacks, we will be going back to an old favourite, Android App Development!

The mobile market (in which Android is the leader in terms of market share) has boomed in recent years and continues to grow. This makes Android application development a useful skill to have, not just for software developers, but for everyone in general.

We will be covering the basics of Android development. This session will be completely hands-on, which means you go home with a functioning Andoid app of your own. So don't forget to get your laptops along.

Before coming for the workshop, be sure to download and install Android Studio: http://developer.android.com/sdk/index.html
